Comores - Projet de Rehabilitation des
            Cocoteraies et de Lutte Contre les Rongeurs

abstracts.cdata!:
This is a project completion report of
            the Coconut Rehabilitation and Rodent Control Project in
            Comoros. This was the first International Development
            Association (IDA)-finance agricultural project in the
            Comoros. It aimed to extend and improve coconut and copra
            production on the three islands of Grande Comore, Anjouan,
            and Moheli, through rodent control, increased productivity
            of the existing stands from replanting and new planting, and
            improvement of copra processing and marketing. Improvement
            was necessary on all islands either because of poor
            maintenance of plantations, poor genetic quality and age of
            palms, or limited marketing, and processing facilities. The
            project aims fitted well with the need for the Comoros to
            increase the income level of its people through increased
            agriculture production and also with government's
            objective to meet present and future coconut demand for
            domestic consumption and to re-establish the previous export
            levels of copra. The project, to be implemented by the
            ministry of production over a period of five years, included
            the establishment of a rodent control unit, the creation of
            a copra processing and marketing service, the establishment
            of seed gardens and nurseries for the production of
            high-yielding coconut planting material, training and
            technical assistances, studies and the creation of a project
            management, and administrative service.
